meanings.definition: A place where roads meet; an intersection.
meanings.sent1: I always get confused at the carrefours near my house.
meanings.sent2: The carrefours in the city are always busy with traffic.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken cross the carrefours? To get to the other side!
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like carrefours, constantly intersecting and changing direction.
meanings.sent5: The carrefours were like a puzzle, each road leading to a different destination.

meanings.definition: A point at which something diverges or changes direction.
meanings.sent1: The carrefours in the river marked the spot where the water split into two streams.
meanings.sent2: At the carrefours of life, we must make decisions that determine our path.
meanings.sent3: The carrefours in the plot of the movie kept the audience guessing.
meanings.sent4: His career took a sudden turn at the carrefours of opportunity.
meanings.sent5: The carrefours of fate led them to unexpected outcomes.
